in his hat galloped up to Kutu- zov and asked in the Emperor's name had the fourth column advanced into action. 
Kutuzov turned round without answering and his eye happened to fall upon Prince An- drew, who was beside him. Seeing him, Kutu- zov's malevolent and caustic expression sof- tened, as if admitting that what was being done was not his adjutant's fault, and still not an- swering the Austrian adjutant, he addressed Bolk6nski.
